intro: Ilex dasyphylla var. lichuanensis, commonly known as the Lichuan holly, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its spiny leaves and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. It has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 5 meters. Its foliage is often used in traditional Chinese medicine and horticulture.
